channel.title: CVE Feed for themeisle -- Visualizer: Tables and Charts Manager for WordPress
channel.description: The latest CVEs for themeisle -- Visualizer: Tables and Charts Manager for WordPress

item.title: CVE-2022-2444|2024-08-03T00:39:07.845Z -- themeisle -- visualizer%3A%20tables%20and%20charts%20manager%20for%20wordpress
item.description: The Visualizer: Tables and Charts Manager for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to deserialization of untrusted input via the 'remote_data' parameter in versions up to, and including 3.7.9. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor privileges and above to call files using a PHAR wrapper that will deserialize the data and call arbitrary PHP Objects that can be used to perform a variety of malicious actions granted a POP chain is also present. It also requires that the attacker is successful in uploading a file with the serialized payload.

item.title: CVE-2022-46848|2024-08-03T14:39:39.058Z -- themeisle -- visualizer%3A%20tables%20and%20charts%20manager%20for%20wordpress
item.description: Auth. (contributor+) Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Themeisle Visualizer: Tables and Charts Manager for WordPress plugin <=Â 3.9.1 versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-3750|2024-06-04T17:33:17.721Z -- themeisle -- visualizer%3A%20tables%20and%20charts%20manager%20for%20wordpress
item.description: The Visualizer: Tables and Charts Manager for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification and retrieval of data due to a missing capability check on the getQueryData() function in all versions up to, and including, 3.10.15. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to perform arbitrary SQL queries that can be leveraged for privilege escalation among many other actions.

item.title: CVE-2024-3750|2024-08-01T20:20:01.020Z -- themeisle -- visualizer%3A%20tables%20and%20charts%20manager%20for%20wordpress
item.description: The Visualizer: Tables and Charts Manager for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification and retrieval of data due to a missing capability check on the getQueryData() function in all versions up to, and including, 3.10.15. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to perform arbitrary SQL queries that can be leveraged for privilege escalation among many other actions.
